text: Morning workout — finally. Back squats and some cardio. Whoop rewarded me with a 68. First time above 60 this month.
Talked to my therapist about avoidance. She asked what I do when I don't want to feel something. I said 'work.' She nodded slowly.
Morning workout — finally. Back squats and some cardio. Whoop rewarded me with a 68. First time above 60 this month.
Friday night alone. Made a proper meal — short ribs, roasted carrots, the works. Ate at the dining table. Set a place. Lit a candle. It was fine.
Team happy hour at the office. Everyone relaxed, laughing. These are the moments I started the company for.
Hired a head of client services. Finally. Three months of bad hires and one very expensive mistake before this. She starts Monday.
Agency all-hands this morning. Team is energized about the new client pitch. I'm proud of what we've built, even on the hard days.
Friday night alone. Made a proper meal — short ribs, roasted carrots, the works. Ate at the dining table. Set a place. Lit a candle. It was fine.
Agency all-hands this morning. Team is energized about the new client pitch. I'm proud of what we've built, even on the hard days.
Three hours of deep work on a brand deck for a fintech client. Flow state hit around 11am. Missed a lunch meeting. Worth it.
The book draft is 7,000 words. It's bad but it exists. Existence is the prerequisite for revision.
Took the kids to Barton Springs. Maya (12) spent the whole time on her phone. Eli (9) jumped off the rocks like a maniac. Different ages, different worlds.
Year 4 of Roth Creative. We're still here. Bigger than I thought we'd be at this point. I have to remember to feel good about that.
Closed the Varela Hospitality rebrand contract — our biggest yet. $85k project. Bought the team lunch. Ordered too much food on purpose.
Eli asked me this morning 'Daddy, do you miss living with us?' I said yes honestly. He thought about it and said 'I miss it too but this is also okay.' I could've cried.
Started outlining the book again. First chapter is about why most founders don't know what their brand actually is. I think I have something real here.
Asked my AI assistant to help me audit where my time goes. The output was uncomfortable. 38% of my week is reactive. That's not how I want to lead.
Hired a head of client services. Finally. Three months of bad hires and one very expensive mistake before this. She starts Monday.
Kid drop-off week again. House is quiet. The silence used to feel like freedom. Now it just feels like absence.
Friday night alone. Made a proper meal — short ribs, roasted carrots, the works. Ate at the dining table. Set a place. Lit a candle. It was fine.
Talked to my therapist about avoidance. She asked what I do when I don't want to feel something. I said 'work.' She nodded slowly.
Asked my AI assistant to help me audit where my time goes. The output was uncomfortable. 38% of my week is reactive. That's not how I want to lead.
Took the kids to Barton Springs. Maya (12) spent the whole time on her phone. Eli (9) jumped off the rocks like a maniac. Different ages, different worlds.

Closed the Varela Hospitality rebrand contract — our biggest yet. $85k project. Bought the team lunch. Ordered too much food on purpose.
Long call with Maya about school. She wants to take an art class. I said yes before she finished asking. Some decisions are easy.
Whoop score: 34 out of 100. Recovery in the toilet. Skipped the workout anyway and wrote instead. Sometimes rest looks like writing.

Had a call with my accountant. Revenue is up 22% but cash flow is still a mess. Being good at creative work and being good at running a business are two very different things.
